Class Director

    • Employee
      • Director
  • All Implemented Interfaces:

    public class Director
extends Employee
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Mark Dieckmann

      • Fields inherited from class Employee

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Director(String arg1, String arg2, int arg3, double arg4)
      This constructor is called with the details of the worker and it passes these on to the constructor of the superclass.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Director

        public Director(String arg1,
        String arg2,
        int arg3,
        double arg4)
        This constructor is called with the details of the worker and it passes these on to the constructor of the superclass.
        Parameters:
        arg1 - the director's first name.
        arg2 - the director's second name.
        arg3 - the director's employee number.
        arg4 - the salary received by the director.

    • Method Detail

      • addEmployee

        public void addEmployee(Worker arg)
        This instance method adds a worker to the list of subordinates of the director.
        Parameters:
        arg - the worker that is added to the list of subordinates.

      • computeBonus

        public double computeBonus()
        This instance method computes the bonus of the director. The bonus equals the 10 per cent of the cumulative salary of all his/her subordinates.
        Returns:
        the bonus received by the director.

      • computeTaxes

        public double computeTaxes()
        This instance method computes the taxes the director has to pay. The taxes are 25 per cent of the sum of the salary and the bonus.
        Specified by:
        computeTaxes in class Employee
        Returns:
        the taxes.

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo(Employee arg)
        This instance method compares two employees.
        Parameters:
        arg - the employee with which this employee is compared.
        Returns:
        a value -1, 0, 1 depending on if the salary of this employee is higher, equal or lower than that of arg.
